tokens.text: triggers tick events on an interval

fields.title: Interval Range
fields.description: A range of values, specified in ticks, that will be used to decide the interval between times this block will tick. Each interval will be chosen randomly from the range, so the times between this block ticking will differ given an interval_range of two different values. If the values in the interval_range are the same, the block will always be ticked after that number of ticks.
fields.technicalDescription: The first value must be equal or lower than the second value

fields.title: Looping
fields.description: Does the block tick continuously? If false, the block will only be ticked once, after a delay equal to a number of ticks randomly chosen from the interval_range. If true, the block will loop, and each interval between ticks will be equal to a number of ticks randomly chosen from the interval_range.

description: Schedules periodic tick events for the block, similar to how crops grow or ice melts over time. Configure the interval range in ticks (20 ticks = 1 second) and whether looping continues. Tick events trigger custom logic for growth stages, decay, spreading, random animation, or any time-based block behavior.
